examples: She helped her father pick out a matching tie for his business meeting.
They knew that hawks will not pick out hawks' eyes, and they always acted in each other's best interests.
The majority picked out the original artworks.
You pick out the meat.
So, you picked out some ties.
words.defineEn: to choose among a group of people or things
words.defineVi: để lựa chọn trong số một nhóm người hoặc những điều

examples: Just because you don’t get what you want from people does not mean you should end communication with them and therefore throw out the baby with the bathwater.
The employee did not quit his job until he had secured a better one, believing in the saying 'never throw out your dirty water until you get in fresh.'
Janet quitting her job because her ex started working there is a classic example of throwing out the baby with the bathwater.
People throw out 100,000 chopsticks every day here in Vancouver.
There, people throw out 130 million pairs every single day.
words.defineEn: to get rid of something that is no longer needed
words.defineVi: để loại bỏ một cái gì đó không còn cần thiết

examples: The disease wiped out 40 million rabbits at a stroke.
At the same time as this cold spell, an extinction event wiped out many large vertebrates in the Americas, Europe, Africa, and Asia.
The yearlong was wiped out.
Back in the BCE era, entire ideas, religions, and political movements were wiped out.
In a team effort, the infection is wiped out.
words.defineEn: to completely eliminate or remove
words.defineVi: để loại bỏ hoàn toàn hoặc loại bỏ

examples: She was put down as the most talented musician in the competition.
She was put down for the team's upcoming match.
But the forces of the Holy Alliance of Austria, Prussia and Russia put down both revolts.
Put down your crossbows.
Put down a little bit of the sauce.
words.defineEn: to stop carrying something by putting it on the ground
words.defineVi: để ngừng mang một cái gì đó bằng cách đặt nó trên mặt đất

examples: She called on both sides to stop the violence.

In many instances, the private sector is calling on this administration for this type of leadership.
The plan called on states to reduce carbon emissions from fossil fuel power plants by the year 2030.
words.defineEn: to ask or demand a person or organization to do something, usually officially
words.defineVi: yêu cầu hoặc yêu cầu một người hoặc tổ chức làm điều gì đó, thường là chính thức

examples: The musician stepped up his game and practiced his instrument for hours every day, resulting in a more polished and professional sound.
If you want to pass your next math test, you need to step up your game and study more.
Competition steps up for Party City around Halloween.
Now tech giants like Google, Twitter, Facebook and Microsoft are stepping up.
So step up your game a little bit.
words.defineEn: to increase the size, amount, intensity, speed, etc. of something
words.defineVi: để tăng kích thước, số lượng, cường độ, tốc độ, vv của một cái gì đó

examples: She looked on the point of tears.

words.defineVi: để xem hoặc quan sát một sự kiện hoặc sự cố mà không tham gia

examples: I can't believe he got away with cheating on his taxes again.
I held the attacker at bay while Mary got away and called the police.
Hey, get away!
You get away quickly.
Could any other company get away with selling a brick or a branded crowbar?
words.defineEn: to escape from someone or somewhere
words.defineVi: để thoát khỏi một ai đó hoặc một nơi nào đó

examples: The facility is named after Dr. George Glenner and his wife, Joy.

words.defineVi: đặt tên cho ai đó hoặc cái gì đó để vinh danh hoặc để tưởng nhớ người hoặc vật khác

examples: He went at it hammer and tongs as soon as he got back from work.

examples: You touched on this issue.

This is really touching on the behavioral financial aspect of this.

words.defineVi: để đề cập ngắn gọn một chủ đề trong cuộc thảo luận bằng văn bản hoặc nói

examples: Taft goes on to the campaign trail and wins.

Let's go on to the good things.
Now, let's go on to rhombus.
- This is like going on to the Grand Canyon - Look at that.

words.defineVi: để chuyển sang làm một cái gì đó sau khi bạn đã hoàn thành một cái gì đó khác

examples: He turned up the collar of his coat.

examples: Douglas held his tongue, preferring not to speak out on a politically sensitive issue.
I'm sure he will get on his soapbox and speak out against the proposed changes.
If you're thinking of speaking out against the company, remember that dead men tell no tales.
Although he didn't agree with the decision that was being made, he remained silent and didn't speak out - silence is half consent, and his lack of objection was seen as agreement.
All the other kids in the class were too afraid to speak out, but Georgina took a stand for what she knew was right.

words.defineVi: thể hiện ý kiến của mình một cách cởi mở và không sợ hãi hay do dự

examples: And stay away from the water.

examples: I do want to act on this.

words.defineVi: để hoàn thành một hình thức chính thức hoặc tài liệu bằng cách viết thông tin về nó

examples: James, in the vale of his years, reflects on his life's journey and the wisdom he has gained along the way.

The business owner reflected on his own youthful mistakes, acknowledging that wanton kittens make sober cats, and that his early errors had taught him valuable lessons that he applied to his business practices.
They will be wise after the event and reflect on what could have been done better.
The team captain felt the pressure of leading his team to victory, knowing that the outcome would reflect on his leadership.
After the breakup, she spent several weeks licking her wounds and reflecting on the relationship before moving on.

words.defineVi: để xem xét hoặc suy nghĩ cẩn thận và sâu sắc về một cái gì đó; để bày tỏ một ý kiến hoặc suy nghĩ đó là kết quả của một sự phản ánh bằng văn bản hoặc bài phát biểu

examples: Our visual system picks up on the shapes, edges and finer details of the mantis’s disguise.

examples: We had to lift up the back just a little bit.

examples: For 10 years she looked after her children, with her career very much on the back burner.

examples: I had a swim to cool down.

A scoop of muskmelon sorbet is the perfect dessert to cool down after a spicy meal.
A scoop of tayberry ice cream was the perfect treat to cool down on a hot day.
I enjoy eating ice cream to cool down in the hot summer months.
